channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Somber Minneapolis demonstrators protest fatal shooting of woman by ICE officer
item.description: Hundreds of somber demonstrators took to Minneapolis' frozen streets to protest the fatal shooting of a woman by an ICE agent.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of somber demonstrators took to Minneapolis' frozen streets to protest the fatal shooting of a woman by an ICE agent.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Ex-U.S. deputy assistant AG on Trump administration's narrative around ICE shooting
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Elliot Williams, a former U.S. deputy assistant attorney general, about the Trump administration's narrative around the fatal shooting of a woman in Minnesota by an ICE agent.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Elliot Williams, a former U.S. deputy assistant attorney general, about the Trump administration's narrative around the fatal shooting of a woman in Minnesota by an ICE agent.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: NASA ends mission at the space station a month early due to 'medical situation'
item.description: NASA is ending its Crew-11 mission to the International Space Station a month early. The agency announced one of the four crew members has a "serious medical condition" and needs to return to Earth.
item.content:encoded: NASA is ending its Crew-11 mission to the International Space Station a month early. The agency announced one of the four crew members has a "serious medical condition" and needs to return to Earth.
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: Michael B. Jordan expands his cinematic universe
item.description: From child actor to "Sexiest Man Alive" leading man status, Jordan takes on Hollywood as director-producer and soon may win awards for his performance in Sinners.
item.content:encoded:
From child actor to "Sexiest Man Alive" leading man status, Jordan takes on Hollywood as director-producer and soon may win awards for his performance in Sinners.

(Image credit: Jeff Spicer)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The mood in Minneapolis after a fatal shooting by an ICE agent, Portland officials call uptick in ICE shootings a "pattern of violence," Trump says the U.S. could be "running" Venezuela for years.
item.content:encoded: The mood in Minneapolis after a fatal shooting by an ICE agent, Portland officials call uptick in ICE shootings a "pattern of violence," Trump says the U.S. could be "running" Venezuela for years.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: The Golden Globes are this weekend. Hear from some of the nominees
item.description: The Golden Globe are Sunday night. Revisit some of the nominees that have appeared on NPR's "Morning Edition" this past year.
item.content:encoded: The Golden Globe are Sunday night. Revisit some of the nominees that have appeared on NPR's "Morning Edition" this past year.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Many Americans say the U.S. is not a moral leader but want it to be: NPR/Ipsos poll
item.description: A new NPR/Ipsos poll found Americans across the political spectrum want the U.S. to be the moral leader of the world, but far fewer believe it actually is.
item.content:encoded: A new NPR/Ipsos poll found Americans across the political spectrum want the U.S. to be the moral leader of the world, but far fewer believe it actually is.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Trump to meet with U.S. oil executives for help reviving Venezuela's oil industry
item.description: President Trump wants U.S. oil companies to help revitalize Venezuela's struggling oil industry. But with oil prices low and the political future uncertain, oil companies may be reluctant to gamble.
item.content:encoded: President Trump wants U.S. oil companies to help revitalize Venezuela's struggling oil industry. But with oil prices low and the political future uncertain, oil companies may be reluctant to gamble.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: A look at how the cocaine trade works
item.description: The business of cocaine trafficking has changed over the years, with different players and routes. A look at how the trade really works.
item.content:encoded: The business of cocaine trafficking has changed over the years, with different players and routes. A look at how the trade really works.
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: Trump administration's fraud claims spotlight long-standing vigilance issue
item.description: The Trump administration's allegations about benefits fraud highlights a problem states led by both parties have faced for a long time -- the need for vigilance.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration's allegations about benefits fraud highlights a problem states led by both parties have faced for a long time -- the need for vigilance.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden
